title: Asian stocks find modest support on firmer U.S. futures
text: Asian shares eked out meager gains on Wednesday, as higher Wall Street futures provided some relief for investors after an overnight U.S. selloff, though deeper worries about the global economy are likely to keep a lid on sentiment.

title: Jim Cramer: Investors must remove political beliefs from investment decisions
text: Jim Cramer breaks down why investors must disentangle investment decisions from political beliefs.

title: Cramer: Three charts show investors should get ready for a big rally in the stock market in Septembe
text: "The charts, as interpreted by the legendary Larry Williams, suggest that it's time to stop panicking, stop complaining and start buying," Jim Cramer says.

title: Jim Cramer breaks down recession fears — 'I think the yield curve linkage is wrong'
text: "Until we get some tangible signs that the economy's picking up, you're going to have to get used to the market," Jim Cramer says.

title: Peloton Files to Go Public on Nasdaq as Losses Grow
text: Peloton Interactive Inc., the home exercise startup, has filed an initial public offering. The New York-based company listed its offering size as $500 million in a filing Wednesday with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Bloomberg's Nabila Ahmed has more on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Beware of cracks in the metal trade: Technician
text: Chris Verrone Strategas technician, on which metals you should watch.

title: Strategist says the biggest bubble ever about to burst
text: Julian Emanuel BTIG chief equity and derivatives strategist, on the world's biggest bubble.

title: Wall St. bear David Rosenberg warns of a 100% change of recession, based on yield curve inversion
text: David Rosenberg, Gluskin Sheff chief economist, says the 3-month/10-year yield curve inversion shows a 100% chance of recession.

title: Another rate shock hits stocks, what's next for the market?
text: Stocks tumble as rates drop.

title: Peloton files for IPO under ticker PTON
text: CNBC's Leslie Picker reports that Peloton has filed for an IPO. The Fast Money traders weigh in.

title: Peloton files publicly for IPO
text: Peloton, the well-funded maker of high-tech bikes and treadmills, has revealed documents for its upcoming initial public offering.

title: Why should the Fed cut rates?
text: EventShares CIO Ben Phillips asks why would the Fed cut rates if inflation is in check and unemployment is low.

title: Oil futures extend gains on larger-than-expected U.S. crude draw
text: Oil prices rose in volatile trade on Tuesday supported by expectations of a drawdown in U.S. crude inventories, though  gains were capped by worries about a recession and uncertainty over a China-U.S.

title: Dip into small, mid-cap equities with no China exposure: Kevin O'Leary
text: Kevin O'Leary, chairman of O'Shares ETFs, and Margie Patel, senior portfolio manager at Wells Fargo Asset management, join CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the day's market action.

title: Russell weakness bled into other indexes, caused day's sell-off: TD Ameritrade's Hincks
text: Kevin Hincks, senior equity strategist at TD Ameritrade, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" for trade the close with a look at the day's market action and which earnings he's keeping an eye on this week.

title: Stock Market Today: Gold, Silver Hit Multi-Year Highs
text: Gold and silver are hitting new highs, and so are Shopify and Chipotle Mexican Grill. Here's what happened in the stock market today.

title: Fed divided on policy, discount rate votes show
text: U.S. central bankers may have been more deeply divided than previously understood over the decision last month to cut interest rates for the first time in more than a decade, records from meetings held across the Fed's 12 regional Fed banks suggest.

title: Dow Jones Today: Not Much Activity, But That’s OK
text: An interesting fact, courtesy of the ETF Research Center, the price-to-earnings ratio on the SPDR Dow Jones Industrial ETF (NYSEARCA:DIA), the Dow tracking ETF, currently resides in an area that was seen following the fourth-quarter 2018 and May 2019 declines, which eventually gave way to equity market rallies.

title: Why this CEO says markets will be volatile for the foreseeable future
text: CNBC's "Closing Bell" team breaks down how markets are trading and what investors should be watching amid trade war uncertainty, with Steve Grasso of Stuart Frankel and John Koudounis, CEO of Calamos Investments.

title: U.S. yield inversion deepens, stokes recession fears
text: The U.S. yield curve inversion deepened on Tuesday to levels not seen since 2007, rekindling fears of a looming recession that spurred a sell-off on Wall Street and stoked even more safe-haven demand for government bonds.

title: Stock Market in the Red on Tuesday
text: U.S. stocks were in the red on Tuesday. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.28% to 25,826, the S&P 500 Index declined 0.19% to 2,873 and the Nasdaq Composite Index dipped 0.24% to 7,834.

title: Markets call for energy sector consolidation: Equity research expert
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team discusses the energy sector and how investors should play the space with Mike Kelly of Seaport Global Securities.

title: Be prepared for what could be a messy next few months: United Capital founder
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team discusses how markets are trading and looming recession fears with Joe Duran, CEO of United Capital, and Art Hogan of National Securities.

title: United States: Political Risks To Recession And Fed/Macro Policy
text: Forward-looking multi-country weekly updates from GeoQuant's high-frequency political risk intelligence platform.

title: Stock dividends are yielding more than the 30-year Treasury note for the first time in a decade
text: For the first time since the financial crisis, the 30-year treasury note is earning less for investors than stocks.

title: Should former NY Fed President have spoken out against President Trump in op-ed?
text: Heritage Capital President Paul Schatz along with Yahoo Finance's Rick Newman, Julie Hyman and Brian Cheung discuss Bill Dudley's op-ed which addressed the importance of the Federal Reserve remaining independent.

title: Fed rejects call to deny Trump rate cuts; Trump keeps up pressure
text: The U.S. central bank on Tuesday rejected a call from a former Federal Reserve policymaker to counter President Donald Trump's trade agenda by refusing to "play along" and denying the president the interest rate cuts he has demanded.

title: New York Fed among six banks voting in July for no change in discount rate
text: Underscoring discord at the U.S. central over interest-rate policy, directors at half of the Federal Reserve's regional Fed banks -- including those at the influential New York Fed -- wanted to keep the emergency lending rate for commercial banks unchanged in July.

title: Investing Strategies: How To Profit On Emerging Trends, From Cannabis To Blockchain
text: As an unresolved trade dispute between the U.S. and China continues to provide uncertainty in the market, we're outlining the key technical levels investors should watch. Plus, the cannabis analyst from William O'Neil + Co. breaks down the state of the new and growing legal marijuana industry – and two pot stocks to watch.

title: Tariff escalations: Body shots to the economy?
text: UBS U.S. Chief Economist Seth Carpenter and CNBC's Rick Santelli discuss economic crosscurrents.

title: SEC fines audit firm RSM $950,000 to settle independence violation claim
text: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Tuesday that it fined public accounting firm RSM US LLP $950,000 to settle claims it violated the agency's auditor independence rules.

title: Wall Street slips as financials fall, trade hopes flicker
text: Wall Street slipped on Tuesday hurt by a fall in financial stocks, while revived worries about a U.S. recession overshadowed early optimism of a resolution to the prolonged trade dispute between the world's two largest economies.

title: The central bank has to go where the data is taking it, says Columbus Macro CEO
text: Mariann Montagne, Gradient Investments, Craig Columbus, Columbus Macro CEO, and Fred Kempe, Atlantic Council CEO, join "The Exchange" to discuss how the Fed can assert its independence and why stocks are sliding.

title: Stock Market Volatility: Technical Levels To Watch
text: The Nasdaq and the S&P 500 are holding their Aug.

title: 2-year Treasury note auction is the lowest since Sept. 2017
text: The two-year bond auction results are in.

title: Institutional investors are buying the dip: Loop Capital's Gibson
text: Kourtney Gibson, president and partner at Loop Capital Markets, joins CNBC's "Fast Money Halftime Report" team to discuss the trade war risks weighing on stocks and what she is watching during the uncertainty.

title: Fed needs to be cautious of deflation: Four-star bond manager
text: Rick Rieder, chief investment officer of global fixed income at BlackRock, joins CNBC's "Fast Money Halftime Report" team to discuss his take on the Federal Reserve and whether the Fed should raise interest rates.

title: How investors can protect themselves in a market with volatility and low yields
text: Pacer ETF's President Sean O'Hara discusses what investors should be doing in a volatile market.

title: The Fed should continue to not comment, says former Dallas Fed president
text: Richard Fisher, former Dallas Fed president, calls into 'Fast Money Halftime Report' discuss former Fed President Bill Dudley's statement that the 'Fed shouldn't enable Trump.

title: The Technical Indicator: Bull trend (tenuously) intact: S&P 500 rattles the August range
text: Technically speaking, the S&P 500 has maintained its August range amid trade-related volatility, preserving a bullish longer-term bias, writes Michael Ashbaugh.

title: Fmr. NY Fed President: Fed shouldn't enable Trump
text: Yahoo Finance's Brian Cheung reports onFormer N.Y.

title: Gamco CEO Gabelli on Media M&A, Industrials, Stock Picking
text: Mario Gabelli, chairman and chief executive officer at Gamco Investors, discusses the market impact of politics, why he sees CBS-Viacom deal as a buy for investors, finding value in music and industrial companies, and understanding stock picking. He speaks on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Oil turns lower as stock market weakens on trade deal uncertainty
text: Oil prices were steady to soft on Tuesday, paring earlier gains along with the stock market lower as China dampened optimism for a trade deal with the United States.

title: Why this strategist says the 'economic tide' is still strong
text: Scott Clemons, Brown Brothers Harriman CIO of private wealth management, and Mark Mahaney, RBC Capital Markets managing director and lead internet analyst, join "Squawk Alley" to discuss the market as fears of a recession loom.

title: Markets are 'jittery because of trade uncertainty,' says portfolio manager
text: Key Advisors Group Co-Founder Eddie Ghabour discusses the markets, trade tensions and the likelihood a recession.

title: Italy’s Economy Stuck in Stagnation for 2019 and 2020, Says ADA Economics’s Tenconi
text: Aug.27 -- Raffaella Tenconi, chief economist and founder at ADA Economics, discusses politics in Italy, its impact on Italy’s economy and losing its investment grade status.

title: Legendary investor Mark Mobius on the top emerging markets
text: Mark Mobius, legendary investor and author of "Invest for Good: A Healthier World and a Wealthier You", joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss where he sees the most opportunity in emerging markets.

title: Jim Cramer on Politics, Altria and Philip Morris and Fantasy Football
text: Jim Cramer weighs in on why investing and politics don't mix.

title: Oil Analyst Sen Says Physical Crude Market Is 'Incredibly Tight'
text: Aug.27 -- Amrita Sen, chief oil analyst at Energy Aspects, discusses the impact of global trade tensions and U.S.sanctions on crude markets

title: Stocks rise as all 11 S&P sectors open on the upside
